forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Clear, with a low around 11. Wind chill values as low as -3. Northwest wind around 12 mph.

forecast.name: Sunday
forecast.detailedForecast: Sunny, with a high near 18. Wind chill values as low as -3. Northwest wind 9 to 13 mph.

weather_report:
As night drapes its velvety cloak over Boston, the air is sharp and crisp, reflecting the temperatures dipping to around 11 degrees, and with the wind chill factor, it feels even colder, biting at exposed skin. The northwest winds twirl their way through the streets, carrying with them a whisper of frost that hints at a chill lingering for the early risers. The city remains blanketed in a serene stillness, the distant hum of urban life flickering intermittently as lights punctuate the darkness, creating a tapestry of warmth against the cool expanse of night.

Come morning, a transformation awaits. The sun will rise with its soft embrace, illuminating the cityscape and lifting spirits with the promise of a clear, sunny day. While the high will reach a mere 18 degrees, the invigorating sunlight will chase away the gloom, though wind chill will still linger as a gentle reminder of winter's presence. On such a day, it is wise to dress in layers—donning a cozy scarf and a sturdy hat may add both warmth and style. Perhaps follow the sun along the Charles, or take the opportunity to visit one of Boston's many museums, where the warmth of culture rivals the chill of the season. A leisurely morning at a local café, watching the world awaken while sipping on a hot beverage, could also provide a delightful respite from the outdoor temperatures. In these moments, one can embrace the beauty of winter in the heart of the city.
